segments.text: Mary , please go to the door . I hear the bell .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's the mailman , Mother . Here's a letter from Uncle George .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Give it to me ... How wonderful ! He's coming to visit us .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: He's coming by car on the twenty-fourth . He's staying from thetwenty-fourth to the twenty-sixth .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Let me look at the calendar . Good ! The twenty-fourth is a Saturday . Is he coming alone ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , he's coming with Aunt Cynthia and the girls .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Mother , I don't remember the girls . How old are they ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Your cousin Fay is fifteen . Rosemary is older than Fay . She's seventeen .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Are they going to stay here with us ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Of course . The girls can stay in your room with you .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Mother , may we have a party ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: If you like , but now we have to think about meals and many other things .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Prepare the list , Mother . I can go shopping . I can go to the small stores.Everyone knows me there .
segments.speaker: S2
